intro: Saurauia bruneiensis var. bruneiensis, commonly known as the Brunei saurauia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is a small evergreen shrub characterized by its dense, leathery leaves and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces small, dark berries as fruit. This variant is native to Brunei and is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of the region.
